DOC.brief_summary: This observational, multi-center, open-label, prospective study will evaluate the relationship between serum interleukin-6 (IL-6) and C-reactive protein (CRP) levels and methoxy polyethylene glycol-epoetin beta dosage in participants with chronic kidney disease (CKD) on dialysis. Participants will be recruited who are on stable methoxy polyethylene glycol-epoetin beta maintenance therapy or will initiate therapy with methoxy polyethylene glycol-epoetin beta.
DOC.brief_title: An Observational Study of Methoxy Polyethylene Glycol-Epoetin Beta (Mircera) in Chronic Kidney Disease Participants on Dialysis
DOC.criteria: CKD participants undergoing dialysis Participants initiating ESA treatment with methoxy polyethylene glycolepoetin beta or participants on stable methoxy polyethylene glycolepoetin beta maintenance therapy Adequate iron status defined as: serum ferritin above or equal to 100 micrograms per liter (mcg/L) or transferrin saturation above or equal to 20 percent (%) Conditions known to cause inadequate response to ESA treatment Anemia other than symptomatic anemia associated with CKD
